runs.comm: short of length, cuts away a little, Nicol opens the face and runs it down to third-man
short of length coming in with the angle, dabbed towards the left of short fine leg
short, wide, that'll do, it is put away between cover and backward point

that is close, and that is gone, McLaren is pumped, Nicol caught on the pad on the forward defensive push, it was a length ball angled in, looked gone on first view, need to wait for replays, he wasn't too far forward when he was hit, in line with the stumps, not much doubt in that
that was seriously quick, and it bounced and straightened outside off stump, thick outside edge rolls behind point
again, gets it to hurry after pitching, leading edge to point
loopy delivery, fullish, defended
more effort in this one, angled in full, drifts in as well, some bounce, blocked
on the front foot and blocks it out solidly
tossed up full, slight width, driven down to wide long off
opens the face to a slowish delivery, finds backward point
what a tight over, angles it in and finds some spin around off stump, pushed away off the front foot
beaten immediately outside off stump, sharp, straight length ball, he flails at it from the crease
into the pads, full length, away to deep backward square
this time he gets hold of a 140 kph back of a length ball but bashes it straight to short cover
hammered, absolutely hammered through extra cover, there is a big gap there, and McCullum bulldozes a pitched up ball through it
this one comes in from back of a length, he gets on his toes and pushes it out to point
short, wide, 142 kph, he cuts, and underedges it to the lone slip, on the bounce
flighted on middle stump and Guptill tees off over mid on, effortless
full one played out to mid on
that came in with the arm, on off stump, but Guptill was in the crease and able to dab it towards short third, albeit a bit awkwardly
there he comes, jumps more than steps down the crease, reaches the pitch of one angled in, and carts it powerfully down the ground
good comeback, tosses it up slowly, it dips, comes in with the angle, defended uneasily
flatter this time and he immediately makes room for the cut, and dispatches it through point
belated shout for lbw as he is caught half-forward with one that nips in a tad from short of a length, huge inside edge though
delicious drive from Guptill, it was full, some way outside off, and he gets front foot out to lean into a crisp, well-timed boundary
one more, slapped away off the front foot, back of a length, but he has time to get forward and slam it through covers
defends this pitched up ball on the stumps
whoa, now he makes some room outside leg stump, Morkel follows him, Guptill connects with an inside out push, but cannot beat point
another one into the pads, Guptill has not moved anywhere this time, and collects an easy run through square leg
thumped through the off side, but cannot beat the infield
massive confusion, run out chance, McCullum tries to cut, but chops it away, Guptill was gone by several feet, never mind his dive, had the throw from cover hit
worked through square leg for a single

lovely, he looks so good when he bothers to place his hits rather than just try to blast them out of sight, width outside off, there is backward point, but he's delayed the cut enough, and rolled the wrists enough to beat the dive from the fielder
some reply from the bowler, opens him up with one that takes off and holds its line from back of a length outside off
pushed away to covers
and is carted first ball for a monster six over deep extra cover, tossed up, not exactly overpitched, but Guptill had made up his mind, and the slight turn did not bother him
flatter, angled in, worked square to leg
again a quick dart into the pads, he goes back and tucks it to the leg side
some turn again, angled in on leg stump and straightens, defended back to the bowler
pushed to midwicket, been a tidy over barring that first-ball six

oh dear me, what a waste of a wicket, it was angled in and was headed comfortably down the leg side, till Guptill decided he wanted to help it to the fine leg rope, but his paddle ends up as a tame edge in midwicket's hands, hit the toe end, Phangiso has his first international wicket after being expensive in the previous game
holding its line outside off stump, steered to third man
into the pads from round the stumps, hits them down the leg side
thick inside edge onto pad as he looks to punch to the off side
pitched up, angled in, driven solidly to long on
length ball played out to the leg side
remains on the back foot to a tossed up ball that hurries on, defended late
again on the crease, manages to nudge it in front of square leg
New Zealand's chances slipping away now, McCullum jumps out again, and drills the ball flat and straight to the man at wide long off, Phangiso has got two huge wickets in four balls
defended towards point, Franklin hesistant, but eventually they go through for the single
pushed down the pitch, did that carry, no it did not, Phangiso dives, but the ball slips away towards long on
typical calm Franklin push to long on
squeezes a drive off a full delivery out to the sweeper
pulls, but does not time it well, to midwicket
shuffles across, and goes for the pull again, timed better, but midwicket in the way again

New Zealand falling apart here, nothing shot from Munro, he stepped out this time, McLaren kept it short of a good length, Munro stopped, and was in no position to play an aggressive stroke, cramped for room, and ends up edging it to the keeper
pitched up around off stump, pushed neatly to mid off
a forcing pull, it was banged in too short and wide outside off, he swivelled and ended up hitting it high in the air over midwicket, but it had enough on it to trickle into the rope
shuffles across and finds a single to deep square leg
thick inside edge onto the boot as he looks to force it to long on
walks across the stumps and nudges it to short fine
New Zealand need more, he steps out and goes through with the lofted stroke over midwicket, well-timed
bowler dives, extra cover runs across and dives, but the ball eludes both after a push by Neesham
quickish and into the pads, rolls away square to the leg side
unhurried, elegant loft fetches Franklin six over long off, took a step down the track outside leg stump, not quite to the pitch, but no worries in the end
steps out again, but pushes it straight to the bowler
could have been tight, direct hit was needed, Franklin wanted the single but was sent back
wide throw to the keeper from point as Franklin guides it in that region
swept away nicely behind square leg and requires a slide to save the four
backs away but cannot find timing on the flat delivery, hit to extra cover for one
some turn once more for Phangiso, hit on the pads as he misses the pull
he's got this one away, full outside leg stump, and he sweeps it high in the air to deep backward square leg, spectacular dive in the deep, but can't get to the ball
third for Phangiso as Franklin comes down, has a swing and picks out long on
pushed down to long on
reverse sweep first ball, the ball spun away sharply, and he does not get much bat on it
dabbed to short third, who cannot pick it up cleanly, and the single has been taken by the time he does
what a take, Morne Morkel, big man, throws himself to his left at short third man to pouch what was a quite cleanly struck reverse sweep, it was travelling but Morne pounced on it
punched to the off side, Miller runs in from extra cover and slides to parry it towards the bowler
pulled down to long on
skips out and nudges it through midwicket, but the fielders in the deep converge quickly on the ball to avoid the second
thick outside edge runs away through vacant slip, and even Morne Morkel cannot stop it this time as he runs after it from short third
worked past midwicket's dive and this time they get the second
he made room outside leg, but the delivery followed him, and he almost chopped it on to the stumps
works a back of a length ball to deep square leg
and again, goes some feet outside leg stump, and the ball arrives precisely there, giving him no room to do more than drop it softly
back of a length, slapped down to long off
gets the connection, bends across and ramps a full delivery from outside off to the fine leg rope
slower one way down the leg side
full delivery squeezed out to point
South Africa sure there was a thin edge on that attempted cut, keeper goes up immediately, Morne is convinced, the umpire isn;t
he flails, and this time there was an edge for sure, a big one, and de Kock had no chance with his dive, it flies through where first slip would have been
backs away and guides this as it is nearly onto the stumps, away to third man
pacy pitched up delivery on middle, he runs it towards point
nearly in the blockhole, he tries to lift it down the ground, not much timing on the effort
stands several feet outside leg stump, the ball arrives outside off, and he gets some bat on it to extra cover
short, wide, but he has advanced outside leg, and reaches out to hit it towards point
tries to go over midwicket, gets almost nothing on it, ball rolls down the pitch, and settles under the boot of the advancing non-striker

sharp work from the bowler, on two counts, McCullum backs away to mishit a full toss low towards McLaren, who gets down to cup it in his hands, but it has bounced just before, non-striker has meanwhile charged up the pitch, McLaren recovers enough to run to the stumps and take a bail off, hold it in his hands as it flies off, and then throws it onto the ground, they check if the ball carried for a catch, it didn't and Anderson has to go
another one goes, McCullum standing outside leg as usual, cuts the offcutter over point, sweeper makes ground to his left, and takes a tumbling catch
around the blockhole, squeezed out to long on
huge heave and a miss to a slower delivery outside off
very full, dug out towards extra cover
that was sharp, Hira weaving away to the leg side a tad, the ball reared up at his chest, pinged the forearm, and flew over the keeper

hello, two batsmen, same end, Hira bashes it towards mid off and charges down for the single, non-striker races back and dives into his crease, no one at the other end, but Hira turns around and gets back in time
short outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
Hira backing away, and heaving a full one down the ground, through Morne Morkel's hands
walks across for the scoop over short fine, beaten totally by the slower one
very full,  very wide, outside off
Hira going after everything, ends up slicing high over backward point, on the bounce to third man
shortish down the leg side, pulled away neatly, to deep backward square leg
full toss, helped away on the bounce to deep midwicket
back of the hand slower one, he hits out at it, sweeper cover runs in, cover and extra cover run back, no one gets to it
that will be the end of the fun for Hira, swats a full toss straight to long on, they check for the no-ball, Kleinveldt is safe, by an inch or so
slow and short, he pulls it calmly between deep square and deep midwicket
another slower one from back of the hand, sails full and wide outside off
full, drilled down the ground
pushed away tamely towards point
ends with one more back of the hand slower one, dragged wide of deep midwicket, and that is the series won for South Africa
